thread.title: South Florida coral reef protection bill passes House panel
thread.title_full: South Florida coral reef protection bill passes House panel

author: Dan Sweeney
title: South Florida coral reef protection bill passes House panel

organizations.name: southeast florida coral reef ecosystem protection area

text:
South Florida coral reef protection bill passes House panel Coral reef off Fort Lauderdale Susan Stocker / Sun Sentinel Coral along the inside ledge of Barracuda Reef off Port Everglades in Fort Lauderdale. Coral along the inside ledge of Barracuda Reef off Port Everglades in Fort Lauderdale. (Susan Stocker / Sun Sentinel) Caption Mike Pence visits Coral Springs' Church by the Glades 
Vice President Mike Pence visited Church by the Glades in Coral Springs on March 19, 2017. 
Vice President Mike Pence visited Church by the Glades in Coral Springs on March 19, 2017. Caption Mike Pence visits Coral Springs' Church by the Glades 
Vice President Mike Pence visited Church by the Glades in Coral Springs on March 19, 2017. 
Vice President Mike Pence visited Church by the Glades in Coral Springs on March 19, 2017. Caption Boca Raton Mayor Susan Haynie wins re-election 
Boca Raton Mayor Susan Haynie wins re-election against challenger former West Palm Beach commissioner Al Zucaro. 
Boca Raton Mayor Susan Haynie wins re-election against challenger former West Palm Beach commissioner Al Zucaro. Caption Bill Ganz is Deerfield Beach’s new mayor 
Bill Ganz is Deerfield Beach's new mayor. Voters elected him Tuesday to succeed his political rival, the current Mayor Jean Robb. 
Bill Ganz is Deerfield Beach's new mayor. Voters elected him Tuesday to succeed his political rival, the current Mayor Jean Robb. Caption Three Miramar commissioners win re-election 
Maxwell Chambers won a second term as Seat 1 commissioner, Yvette Colbourne was re-elected to Seat 2, and Winston Barnes was re-elected to Seat 3. 
Maxwell Chambers won a second term as Seat 1 commissioner, Yvette Colbourne was re-elected to Seat 2, and Winston Barnes was re-elected to Seat 3. Caption Al Zucaro wanted changes for Boca Raton 
Boca Raton mayoral candidate Al Zucaro talks about his platform of managing growth. 
Boca Raton mayoral candidate Al Zucaro talks about his platform of managing growth. 
Under the bill that passed the House panel, the waters from St. Lucie Inlet in Martin County through the north border of the Biscayne National Park are termed the Southeast Florida Coral Reef Ecosystem Protection Area. 
“It’s a two-step process,” Jacobs said. “The most important thing is to get the monitors out there so we can identify what’s happening. Right now, there’s no monitoring. So, this bill sets up the dotted line — the border where this will happen — and the appropriations bill will find the dollars to make it happen.” 
South Florida’s reef system has been dying at a rapid pace owing to warming ocean temperatures and ocean waters growing more acidic as they take in more carbon dioxide.The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency reported last year that ocean temperatures have been rising faster in the past 30 years than at any point since the 1880s, when record-keeping began. 
Reefs cover less than one percent of the ocean floor, but provide habitat to more than a quarter of ocean fish. The Florida Reef translates to billions of dollars in the local economy from tourism, recreation and fishing. 
A bill identical to the initial version of Jacobs’ billwas filed in the Florida Senate by state Sen. Gary Farmer, D-Fort Lauderdale, but has not yet had a committee hearing. It would have to be changed to match Jacobs’ new bill before it could be passed and move to the governor’s desk for signing. 
, 954-356-4605 or Twitter @Daniel_Sweeney
